main_definition: The act of overseeing or managing a process, task, or group to ensure that it is being conducted properly and efficiently.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Oversight during work tasks or projects
meanings_and_examples.example: As the project manager, I provide supervision to ensure that all team members are completing their assigned tasks on time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Monitoring and guidance of students in an educational setting
meanings_and_examples.example: The teacher provides supervision during lab activities to make sure that each student is following safety protocols.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Overseeing the behavior or actions of individuals, particularly those under one's authority
meanings_and_examples.example: Parents often provide supervision when their children are playing outside to ensure their safety.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The management and oversight of a specific group or department within an organization
meanings_and_examples.example: As the department head, I am responsible for providing supervision to all employees under my jurisdiction.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Supervising individuals in their work environment, such as interns or trainees
meanings_and_examples.example: The senior engineer provides supervision to interns while they complete a project, guiding them and providing feedback along the way.
